profile.title: Hi, I'm Joseph Turner
profile.description: Recent computer science graduate with a passion for full-stack development and data-science. Seeking an entry-level position in web development, devops, or data-science with opportunity to grow into a broader software engineering role. 2 years of experience working with full-stack technologies with a focus on frontend development using React-based frameworks and SQL-based databases. 1 year of experience working with data-science technologies such as R, Python, with a focus in Machine Learning. 1 year of experience working as a DevOps Engineer managing and validating the deployment of kubernetes clusters across multiple cloud providers, developing end-to-end and user-acceptance tests for kubernetes applications.

careerpaths.title: Data Science
careerpaths.description: I have a passion for numbers, and I always have. During my time at Wentworth, I decided to pursue a mathematics minor so that I could continue my career in data, analystics, and mathematics. I completed machine learning, multivariable calculus, and probability and statistics at Wentworth, which has provided me with the conceptual and programming tools necessary to analyze and handle data.

projects.name: Ball IQ
projects.related: Fetched data from official NBA api endpoint & implemented machine learning techniques such as principle-component-analysis, linear-regression and k-nearest-neighbor to project player statistics for the following season.

careerpaths.title: Full-Stack
careerpaths.description: I have always had a desire for a creative outlet through computer science, and full-stack development allows me to apply my love for design to something that will be used by real people. Full-stack development combines my love for design with my love for math, data, and information science in a way that ends in a finished product that can be seen and interacted with.

projects.name: Ball IQ
projects.related: Fetched data from official NBA api endpoint & implemented machine learning techniques to project player statistics for the following season. Designed backend server and database to use stored information to fetch live statistics about a selected player. Frontend created using React framework and ChakraUI React library.

projects.name: Recommendify
projects.related: Integrated Spotify's open-source authentification and user statistics APIs to allow user to sign in using their Spotify credentials. Listener data is fetched from the API and a user's top items are displayed along with a recommendation based upon their top artists and tracks using Spotify's recommendation API. Designed in plain HTML and CSS, packaged with NodeJS and hosted using ExpressJS.

projects.name: RateYourDining
projects.related: Designed and implemented frontend portion of a dining review forum for my university. Created using React and React library ChakraUI in a 'backend-less' environment using Google's firestore and firebase services.

careerpaths.title: DevOps
careerpaths.description: I thrive in positions that require attention to detail and problem-solving. I have interests in maintaining the organization and cleanliness of a software environment. I enjoy spending time identifying weak points and places to improve in the context of a large-scale project.

projects.name: Avesha
projects.related: At Avesha, I was in charge of deploying kubernetes applications and developing automated tests to ensure the applications were distributed correctly within the containerized environment. I used GoLang to develop tests to verify communication across cloud clusters existing on different cloud providers. I was also in charge of testing the end-to-end functionality of Avesha's KubesliceUI application using a containerized testing environment utilizing Ginkgo for validating the information displayed on the site and CypressJS to validate the functionality of the frontend UI.
